DataElement.preferredName: Relationship Tissue Donor Biospecimen HLA Typing Laboratory Procedure Send Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The month, day, and year the related donor sample was sent to the laboratory for HLA typing.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Relationship Tissue Donor Biospecimen HLA Typing Laboratory Procedure Send
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something._Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A process in which blood or tissue samples are analyzed to determine their human leukocyte antigen (HLA) profiles._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Cause or enable to go or be conveyed or transmitted.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.:Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.:Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.
Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: A process in which blood or tissue samples are analyzed to determine their human leukocyte antigen (HLA) profiles.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:Cause or enable to go or be conveyed or transmitted.

Concepts.definition: A process in which blood or tissue samples are analyzed to determine their human leukocyte antigen (HLA) profiles.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Cause or enable to go or be conveyed or transmitted.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
